issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Currently, capacity scheduler doesn't trim sub queue name when parsing queue names, for example, the configuration

{code}
<configuration>
     <property>
         <name>...root.queues</name>
         <value> a, b  , c</value>
     </property>

     <property>
         <name>...root.b.capacity</name>
         <value>100</value>
     </property>
      
     .......
</property>
{code}

Will fail with error: 
{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal capacity of -1.0 for queue root. a 
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.capacity.CapacitySchedulerConfiguration.getCapacity(CapacitySchedulerConfiguration.java:332)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.capacity.LeafQueue.getCapacityFromConf(LeafQueue.java:196)
        ....
{code}

It will try to find a queues with name " a", " b  ", and " c", which is apparently wrong, we should do trimming on these sub queue names.
fields.summary: CapacityScheduler should trim sub queue names when parse configuration

comments.body: Attached a fix for this issue.

bq.  -1 eclipse:eclipse. The patch failed to build with eclipse:eclipse.
Is this relevant?

Also, can you add a test-case for validating the same for a nested queue?
[~vinodkv], Thanks for review. The "mvn eclipse:eclipse" is not related. And added a test covers nested queue parsing needs trimming.
